newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens unit plans to buy Amana - report.
newsitem.headline: Siemens unit plans to buy Amana - report.

text.p: Bosch-Siemens Hausgeraete (BSGH), a unit of German industrial group Siemens AG, plans to buy U.S. home appliances maker Amana from its parent Raytheon, the news magazine Der Spiegel reported.
The purchase price was said to be $700 million, Spiegel said, adding BSGH management had already approved the plan.
The purchase would put Siemens among the world's leading makers of stoves and refrigerators. Raytheon hopes to focus more on its defence business, the magazine said.
Siemens officials were unavailable for comment.
